notes: Lua VM runs in pure function mode over rx snapshots only; all writes to rx,Vt,K,E,R are denied by Rust guards and ALN contracts.
Mojo kernels limited to numeric post-processing of sensor streams; corridor and residual updates are Rust-only.
Lua scripts may choose among pre-verified actuation profiles but cannot alter corridors or residual monotonicity invariants.
Mojo DSP blocks are confined to estimating rt90 and rtox; all corridor bands and Vt checks are computed in RustALN.
Rust core owns rx mapping, Vt updates, and corridorpresent/safestep enforcement under ALN contracts.
Rust firmware on ARM Cortex-M7 enforces V_{t+1}<=V_t and r_x<=1 predicates at 1 kHz, independent of Lua/Mojo behavior.
ALN contracts declare no corridor no build and violated corridor -> derate/stop invariants for all embedded DSLs.
Global ecosafety grammar v3.2 freezes r_x in [0,1] and V_{t+1}<=V_t as non-negotiable predicates across all cyboquatic nodes.
